title: 'End of an era' for K.M. Smith Elementary School 19 hours ago
content: NANTICOKE, LUZERNE COUNTY —   It's the end of an era for one Luzerne County School.    K.M. Smith Elementary School has been around for almost 90 years. The school that serves kids in Pre-K to second grade was built in the 1930's and has outlived its service life.    Friday, teachers and students held an end-of-the-year bash to celebrate the school's legacy.    Marcy Huber has a special connection to this building.    "I went to K.M. Smith Elementary in the 70's. So I've gone to school here and I've been a teacher here for the past 20 years. So it's really special. It's the end of an era for sure. We're all happy to be moving to a new building but we all love K.M. Smith," Huber said.    Students will now attend the Kennedy Early Childhood Center.
